answers.author: Robert Belleman
answers.text:
Andrew:  I attended SEI in 2009 and found the leadership program to be of great value.  The presenters were knowledgeable, the discussion was enriching and the networking was enlightening.  I choose SEI because it was a two week program and more affordable for my community.  The University of Virginia is rich in history, which is an excellent setting for discussing the importance local government is to Democracy.  I would encourage you to attend.

answers.author: Richard Brown
answers.text:
I attended the one week SEI program in 2007.  It combined a group of credentialed managers with emerging leaders.  The program itself was excellent but the mix of experience levels seemed to really work.

answers.author: Mark Swenson
answers.text:
Andrew, is there anything specific you are looking for? I don't have any contacts in ELPs for municipal managers, but I have contacts that are trainers for DoD civilians in a couple of ELPs as well as several graduates from the program. If it is general experience , curriculum, methodology, or lessons learned, I can pull some stuff from them

author: Andrew Pederson
text: Looking for examples or comments at experiences at various Executive Leadership Institutes, such as SEI, Harvard, Rocky Mountain Institute.  TYhanks,
title: Executive Leadership Insitutes
